intro: Lacis fallacissima, commonly known as the deceptive lichen, is a species of lichen that exhibits unique botanical characteristics. It belongs to the family Parmeliaceae and is known for its intricate symbiotic relationship between a fungus and a photosynthetic partner, typically a green alga or cyanobacterium. The thallus of Lacis fallacissima is typically crustose, forming a thin, adherent layer on rocks or bark. It is often found in humid, shaded environments, thriving in temperate to tropical climates. Its morphology and chemical composition make it an important subject in studies of lichen ecology and symbiosis.
